controls.title: Ensure AIDE is installed
controls.description: AIDE takes a snapshot of filesystem state including modification times, permissions, and file hashes which can then be used to compare against the current state of the filesystem to detect modifications to the system.
controls.rationale: By monitoring the filesystem state compromised files can be detected to prevent or limit the exposure of accidental or malicious misconfigurations or modified binaries.
controls.audit:
Run the following command to verify AIDE is installed:
# rpm -q aide
aide-<version>
controls.remediation:
Run the following command to install AIDE:
# dnf install aide
# aide --init
# mv /var/lib/aide/aide.db.new.gz /var/lib/aide/aide.db.gz
controls.cis_controls:
v8: 3.14 Log Sensitive Data Access
v7: 14.9 Enforce Detail Logging for Access or Changes to Sensitive Data

controls.title: Ensure filesystem integrity is regularly checked
controls.description: Periodic checking of the filesystem integrity is needed to detect changes to the filesystem.
controls.rationale: Periodic file checking allows the system administrator to determine on a regular basis if critical files have been changed in an unauthorized fashion.
controls.audit:
Run the following commands to verify a cron job or systemd timer is scheduled:
# crontab -u root -l | grep aide
# grep -r aide /etc/cron.* /etc/crontab
# systemctl is-enabled aidecheck.timer
controls.remediation:
Run the following command:
# crontab -u root -e
Add the following line to the crontab:
0 5 * * * /usr/sbin/aide --check
